htmlData:
Location TypeSituated in a rural area.
Premises SituationSingle premises within own grounds.

Approx. date of Construction / Refurbishment /Conversion

2022.

Building Classification

Main Occupancy: Assembly & Recreation 5.
Details of construction / Primary load bearing structureTraditional brick.

Concrete floor.

Compartmentation

Note this is not an intrusive assessment and the full extent of the separating floor has not been examined.
Floor ConstructionConcrete floor
Number of floors, ground and above2
Floors below ground0
Approximate Dimensions15m x 40m
Roof DetailsThe premises has a flat roof.
Roof VoidsThere were no roof voids present.
Light Wells and AtriaThere are no light wells in this premises.
Vehicle parkingParking is to front of premises.

External Fire Spread

This building does not come under the scope of the Fire Safety England Regulations 2024.

General Occupancy TypeVeterinary practice.
Hours of workStandard daytime business hours and evening/night shifts.

General Means of Escape DescriptionThe first floor is provided with two staircases. All areas on the first floor have access to both staircases which are separated from each other by fire resisting construction. The main staircase is an accommodation staircase as it leads into the main reception and waiting area, it has fire doors at the top. The other staircase is at the opposite end and is protected, it leads to the ground floor with two exits.
The ground floor has access to both these escape routes.
Escape stair arrangementsThe premises have one accommodation stair serving the first floor which terminates in a reception area with final exits. Protected escape stairs areapproached through a lobby arrangement on all levels.

Disabled escape arrangements

Disabled Refuges Suitable disabled refuges are provided within, or immediately adjacent to, the means of escape.

Evacuation Aids There are no evacuation aids installed within the premises, and none are required, as suitable alternative arrangements are in place.

Structural fire protection documentation

The following descriptions and commentary reflect the consultantsâ€™ observations, made during a non-intrusive inspection of the premises, as described in the scope of this fire risk assessment.
Structural Fire Protection Offered to Escape RoutesEscape routes are separated from the remainder of the premises by fire resistant construction and fire doors which are either self-closing or which should be kept locked shut.

The construction around cross corridor smoke stop doors extends from the floor slab to the underside of the floor above.
Protection offered to inner roomsWhere present, inner rooms are provided withautomatic detection in access rooms and fire alarm sounders that can be heard in inner rooms.

Single Direction Means of Escape Travel Distances - Taking into Consideration the Risk Profile of the Occupants / Area of the Premises Served by the Escape Route

The single direction means of escape are in keeping with recommendations set out in National guidance.

Two Direction Means of Escape Travel Distances - Taking into Consideration the Risk Profile of the Occupants/Area of the Premises Served by the Escape Route

Two direction travel distances are in keeping with recommendations set out in National guidance.

External escape routes and protection offered

There is no external stairway at this premises.

Number and layout of exits, Exit capacity, Exit separation

The number of exits available appear to be suitable for the number of occupants.

Exits are separated from each other by a suitable angle of convergence or fire resisting construction.

The available escape capacity gives no obvious cause for concern.

Manual Door Fastening

 Doors on escape routes can be opened easily, at all material times, without the use of keys, codes, or fobs, when approached in the direction of escape, Emergency door furniture, that is suitable for the occupancy type and number, is fitted to the doors on escape routes.

Automatic Door Fastenings and Release Mechanisms or Holders

There are no automatic release mechanisms fitted to doors on escape routes.

Fire Assembly Point

The location of the assembly point is notified to occupants by fire action notices which is suitable and sufficient.

Car park.
Signs and NoticesAdequate escape signage is provided to the means of escape routes and staircases to the premises.

Correctly completed fire action notices are provided in the vicinity to fire alarm call points.

Fire alarm strategy

Operates on an unconfirmed regime; but should be a Â  Single stage alarm.
Fire detection and alarm systems

As far as can be determined within the scope of this assessment the fire detection and fire alarm system appears to meet the requirements of a BS5839 part 1 system with a category classification ofÂ  L2.

Automatic Fire Detection & Alarm system consists of:

Automatic detectionin escape routes, adjacent rooms and in higher risk rooms. Throughout the building.

Fire alarm call pointsare located at final exits and story exits.

The primary means of giving warning of fire isautomatic audible alarms

Location of the main Fire Alarm Control panel and indicating equipment

The location of the main fire alarm panel is suitable and obvious to responding fire fighters.

Repeater Fire Alarm Panels

No repeater panels are installed within the property or required.

Fire alarm zone information provided at the fire alarm panel

Is displayed at the main fire alarm panel in the form ofhard copy fire zone plan.

The information providedis clear and simple to understand.

Cause & effects description for the fire detection system

A documented cause & effects description for the fire detection system was not available. The fire detection and alarm systemdoes not appear to be interfaced with other systems.

Emergency Lighting

Emergency lighting at this premises is provided byindividual self-contained mains powered luminaires.

Smoke Ventilation

Manually operable windows are provided on escape routes.

Automatic Sprinkler System

The sprinkler system was confirmed on the day of assessment.

Other Fire Suppressions Systems

There were none installed or made known to the assessor.

Wet/Dry Risers

There are no dry/wet riser in this premises.

First Aid Fire Fighting

Fire extinguishers are wall mounted or placed on stands at easily identified suitably designated and located fire points.

Fire Hydrants

The location of the nearest public fire hydrant was not established however is suspected as being on the access roads.

Passenger and Disabled Access Platform Lifts (DAPL)

The building is served by 1 passenger lifts which in turn serve all floors.

There are no DAPLs installed in the premises.
Fire Service and Evacuation Lifts

There are no lifts, which are intended for use during a fire emergency, installed within this premises.

Mains Electrical incomers and electrical distribution boards (EDBs)

The location of the mains electrical incomer is:

Â  External plant room.

The life safety risks arising from the main electrical incomer are managed and reduced by: Suitable fire resisting construction between the incomer location and the means of escape, The provision of automatic fire detection.

EDBs are not located in the means of escape.

Natural Gas Supplies

The location of the mains supply and associated meters is external plant room

The life safety risks arising from the gas incomer/meters are managed and reduced by: Suitable fire resisting construction between the incomer location and the means of escape; The provision of automatic fire detection; Suitable ventilation.
Are Alternative Fuel Supplies present?There were no alternative fuel supplies noticed at the time of the assessment.
Heating systemsHeating is provided through central boiler plant.

Local heating is provided byindividual air conditioning units.
Alternative power suppliesThere were no alternative power supplies brought to the notice of the assessor at the time of the assessment.

Refuse and waste

Refuse is placed in lockable refuse receptacles located outside the premises.

Dangerous Substances

Risk assessments have been carried out for all dangerous substances within the scope of the regulations.

Full hazard information is available for the dangerous substances on site.

Primary Authority Scheme Partnership arrangements

Metro-SRM have not been advised of any Primary Authority Scheme Partnership Arrangement that the Responsible Person has in place with an enforcing Fire Authority.
Applicable Fire Safety LegislationThe Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 (as amended).
Authority enforcing fire safety legislationLocal Fire and Rescue Authority.
Building Fire strategyA documented fire strategy for these simple premises is not necessary or required, basic fire procedures documents and fire action notices will suffice.

Optimal evacuation strategy for the building occupancy type

The following evacuation strategyhas been confirmed as being in place in the building: Simultaneous evacuation single stage.

This is the optimal evacuation strategy for the occupancy type and is supported by the structural arrangements in the building.
Fire Emergency PlanThere is a suitable and sufficient fire safety emergency plan on site which addresses all aspects of fire response which is practised as part of the evacuation drills.
Policies for Vulnerable People and People with DisabilitiesThe building fire procedure includes arrangements for the evacuation of disabled persons from the building.

Fire Safety Policies

The following policies related to fire safety appear to be in place and effective:
  • Employees, visitors, and contractors.
  • Control of contractors.
Fire Evacuation DrillsAre conducted not less than twice a year.
Fire safety informationIs provided on the fire action notice at the building entrance.

Is provided to staff via induction training and thereafter via periodic fire safety training.

Is provided by training in the form of on-line or electronic training.

Records of basic fire safety checks, service and maintenance visits

Records of basic fire safety checks, service and maintenance visits are recorded in a hard copy fire safety logbook which is held on site and located at: Office.

Records of basic fire safety checks, service and maintenance visits are recorded digitally and made available from Admin assistant.

Documents Information Box (DIB)

Relevant information which will inform and assist responding firefightersis not required for this simple, low risk building.

Cooperation and Coordination

Not Applicable.
Standards of HousekeepingThe standard of housekeeping was found to be well managed in most areas of the building at the time of the assessment with some minor deficiencies noted refer to action plan.

Smoking Assessment

Designated smoking points have not been established and are not required. Occupants leave the premises to smoke.

Fires History

No history of fires, in the building, was made available or reported to Metro SRM prior to, or during the site visit
Unwanted / false fire alarmsNo history of false alarm activations was reported or made available prior to or during the site visit.
FR&S notices and correspondenceNo history of F&RS interventions was reported or made available prior to or during the site visit.

Security ArrangementsStaff, who are awake, are present 24/7.

CCTV cameras monitoring the external areas of the premises.

Basic lock and key facilities.

Perimeter lighting.

Removal/Unlocking of Additional Security Measures on Doors and Escape Routes

Additional security measures areare not applied to final exit doors when the premises are unoccupied.
